Title: Domestic stock investors dominate trade as portfolio transactions surge 42%
Summary: Domestic investors recorded significant growth for the bulk of activity on the Nigerian Exchange Limited (NGX) Total domestic and foreign portfolio transactions rose sharply to N1.38 trillion, reflecting a 42.13 per cent increase from N0.97 trillion recorded in November 2025 .

Title: Fayose reveals ‘what truly happened’ during Makinde–Tinubu meeting
Summary: President Tinubu told Fayose that he was willing to listen to him only on official matters concerning Oyo State . According to Fayose, the president told him that he would listen only to official matters . Fayose reveals ‘what truly happened’ during the meeting .

Title: Emir Sanusi returns to university, resumes studies as law undergraduate
Summary: Emir of Kano, His Eminence Muhammadu Sanusi II, has resumed academic activities as an undergraduate law student at North-West University, Kano . The 16th Emir has returned to university as a law student .

Title: Thai Police arrest 11 Nigerians over alleged international romance scam
Summary: Thai authorities have arrested 11 Nigerians following the dismantling of a suspected international romance scam syndicate operating in the Muang Thong Thani area of Thailand .

Title: Bank customers’ complaints grow by 143%, as CBN resolves 9,771
Summary: CBN resolved 9,771 out of 10,704 bank customers' complaints in the first half of the year . CBN disclosed this in its latest Financial Stability Report . The number of complaints received in H1’25 grew by 143.3 percent year-on-year (YoY) from 4,398 complaints in H

Title: PHOTOS: Gridlock as truck overturns on Otedola Bridge
Summary: A PUNCH Online correspondent travelling along the axis observed that the gridlock stretched backwards from the Otedola Bridge to the Berger axis, as motorists heading into Lagos sought alternative routes . The Rapid Response Squad of the Lagos State Police Command disclosed that a secondary accident occurred as a result of the overturned truck .

Title: Morning Recap: Tinubu posts ambassadors, Wike’s son graduates, other top stories
Summary: President Bola Tinubu posts three ambassador-designates to France, US, UK, UK . Supreme Court closes the long-running Kudirat Abiola murder case . Lagos State Police Command responds to threats against top schools . US raises concerns over the abduction of worshippers in Kaduna .

Title: US completes withdrawal from WHO
Summary: The United States has officially withdrawn from the World Health Organisation, citing the global health body’s handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and failure to implement necessary reforms . The White House said the U.S. will continue its global health leadership through engagements with other countries, private sector actors, non-governmental organisations, and

Title: Police unveil two new outposts in Kogi communities
Summary: The Kogi State Command of the Nigeria Police Force has inaugurated two newly constructed police outposts in Lokoja, the state capital . The newly inaugurated outposts are located in the Adankolo area and the Zango area . The new outposts were part of the Force’s commitment to strengthening the internal security architecture

Title: ICYMI: Tinubu posts three ambassador-designates to France, US, UK
Summary: The approval was announced on Thursday by the Special Adviser to the President on Information and Strategy, Bayo Onanuga . The posting includes Ambassador Ayodele Oke, Colonel Lateef Are, and Ambassador Amin Dalhatu, covering France, the United States, and the United Kingdom .
